lead_paragraph: The Texas A&M regents approved a contract buyout yesterday for the former coach Dennis Franchione that is worth up to $4.4 million over three years. A spokesman for the athletic department said Franchione, who resigned Nov. 23, would be paid up to $1.7 million for each of the next two years. He would receive another $1 million in the third and final year of the agreement. Before he resigned, Franchione’s contract had five years remaining at $2 million a year.Franchione went 32-28 at A&M, far short of the expectations when he replaced R. C. Slocum in December 2002. Off the field, Franchione was reprimanded for selling inside information about the team to boosters.
